name: src/cr/calendar-round.js
CalendarRound
description: A combination of 260-day cycles and the Haab cycle.

params.name: tzolkin_day
params.description: Name of the name in the 260-day cycle

name: tzolkin
description: 260-day cycle component of the Calendar Round

name: haab
description: Haab cycle component of the Calendar Round

name: next
description: Increment both the Haab and 260-day cycle to the next day in the Calendar Round

name: toString
description: Render the CalendarRound cycle date as a string

name: src/cr/haab.js
Haab
description: Describes a Haab date with a position and a month
examples: let day = new Haab(8, new HaabMonth("Kumk'u"));

name: constructor
description: Constructor

params.name: coeff
params.description: The position in the Haab month for this date

name: next
description: Return the next day in the Haab cycle

name: name
description: Return a string representation of the Haab month name

name: toString
description: Render the Haab date as a string

name: HaabMonth
description: Describes only the month component of a Haab date

name: name
description: Name of the Haab month

name: next
description: Return the next month in the Haab cycle

name: src/cr/tzolkin.js
Tzolkin
description: Describes a date in the 260-day cycle with a position and a day
examples: let day = new Tzolkin(4, new TzolkinDay("Ajaw"));

name: constructor
description: Constructor

name: next
description: Return the next day in the 260-day cycle

name: name
description: Return a string representation of the 260-day cycle name

name: toString
description: Render the 260-day cycle date as a string

name: TzolkinDay
description: Describes only the day component of a 260-day cycle

name: name
description: Name of the day in the 260-day cycle

name: days
description: Mapping of day names to indexes

name: next
description: Return the next day in the 260-day cycle

Factory

description: Define properties to be override by sub-classes

name: src/factory/calendar-round.js
CalendarRoundFactory
description: A factory to create a CalendarRound object from a string
examples: let cr = new CalendarRoundFactory().parse("4 Ajaw 8 Kumk'u");

name: constructor
description: Defines the pattern describing a Calendar Round

name: pattern
description: Describes how to break the string into a Calendar Round

name: parse
description: Given a string, parse it and create a Calendar Round

params.name: raw
params.description: A string containing a Calendar Round

name: src/index.js
content:
module.exports = {
  'factory': require('./factory/index'),
  'cr': require('./cr/index'),
  'lc': require('./lc/index'),
  'op': require('./operations/index'),
  'wildcard': require('./wildcard'),
}

name: src/lc/long-count.js
LongCount
description: Long Count cycle

params.name: cycles
params.description: Components in the long count (eg, K'in, Winal, Bak'tun, etc)

name: parts
description: Date Components

name: date_pattern
description: Pattern to validate the date

name: raw
description: Convert individual components to a single string

name: clone
description: Create a copy object of this long count date

name: _get_date_sections
description: Get specific column in Long Count date

name: _set_date_sections
description: Set specific column in Long Count date

name: length
description: Return the number of positions in the long count

name: k_in
description: Set the k'in component of the date

name: k_in
description: Return the k'in component of the date

name: winal
description: Set the winal component of the date

name: winal
description: Return the winal component of the date

name: tun
description: Set the tun component of the date

name: tun
description: Return the tun component of the date

name: k_atun
description: Set the k'atun component of the date

name: k_atun
description: Return the k'atun component of the date

name: bak_tun

name: bak_tun
description: Return the bak'tun component of the date

name: piktun

name: piktun
description: Return the piktun component of the date

description: Return the kalabtun component of the date

description: Set the kinchiltun component of the date

name: kinchiltun
description: Return the kinchiltun component of the date

name: is_valid
description: Ensure the date has only numbers and wildcards separated by points.

name: toString
description: Convert the LongCount to a string and pad the sections of the date
